results.name: Coefficient triangle of polynomials related to the Dirichlet kernel. Rising powers. Riordan triangle ((1+z)/(1+z^2), 2*z/(1+z^2)).
comment: This is the row reversed version of A180870. See also A157751  and A228565.

The Dirichlet kernel is D(n,x) = sum(exp(I*k*x), k=-n..n) = 1 + 2*sum(T(n,x), k=1..n) = S(n, 2*y) + S(n-1, 2*y) = S(2*n, sqrt(2*(1+y))) with y = cos(x), n >= 0, with the Chebyshev polynomials T (A053120) and S (A049310). This triangle T(n, k)gives in row n the coefficients of the polynomial Dir(n,y) = D(n,x=arccos(y)) = sum(T(n,m)*y^m, m=0..n). See A180870, especially the Peter Bala comments and formulas.

This is the Riordan triangle ((1+z)/(1+z^2), 2*z/(1+z^2)) due to the o.g.f. for Dir(n,y) given by (1+z)/(1 - 2*y*z + z^2) = G(z)/(1 - y*F(z)) with G(z) = (1+z)/(1+z^2) and F(z) = 2*z/(1+z^2) (see the Peter Bala formula under A180870). For Riordan triangles and references see the W. Lang link 'Sheffer a- and z- sequences' under A006232.

The A- and Z- sequences of this Riordan triangle are (see the mentioned W. Lang link in the preceding comment also for the references): The A-sequence has o.g.f. 1+sqrt(1-x^2) and is given by A(2*k+1) = 0 and A(2*k) [2, -1/2, -1/8, -1/16, -5/128, -7/256, -21/1024, -33/2048, -429/32768, -715/65536, ...], k >= 0. (See A098597 and A046161.)
The Z-sequence has o.g.f. sqrt((1-x)/(1+x)) and is given by
The column sequences are A057077, 2*(A004526 with even numbers signed), 4*A008805 (signed), 8*A058187 (signed), 16*A189976
The row sums give A005408 (from the o.g.f. due to the Riordan property), and the alternating row sums give A033999.
formula: T(n, m) = [y^m] Dir(n,y)  for  n >=m >= 0 and 0 else, with the polynomials Dir(y) defined in a comment above.
T(n, m) = 2^m*(S(n,m) + S(n-1,m)) with the entries S(n,m) of A049310 given there explicitly.
O.g.f. for polynomials Dir(y) see a comment above (Riordan triangle ((1+z)/(1+z^2), 2*z/(1+z^2))).
O.g.f. for column m: ((1 + x)/(1 + x^2))*(2*x/(1 + x^2))^m, m>=0, (Riordan property).
Recurrence for the polynomials: Dir(n, y) = 2*y*Dir(n-1, y) - Dir(n-2, y), n >= 2, with input D(-1, y) = -1 ans D(0, y) = 1.
Triangle three term recurrence: T(n,m) = 2*T(n-1,m-1) - T(n-2,m) for n >= m >= 1 with T(n,m) = 0 if 0 <= n < m, T(0,0) = 1, T(-1,1) = 0 and T(n,0) = A057077(n) = (-1)^(floor(n/2)).

In analogy to A157751 one can derive a recurrence for the row polynomials Dir(n, y) = sum(T(n,m)*y^m, m=0..n) using also negative argument but only one recursive step: Dir(n,y) = (1+y)*(-1)^(n-1)*Dir(n-1,-y) + y*Dir(n-1,y), n >= 1, Dir(0,y) = 1 (Dir(-1,y) = -1). See also A180870 from where this formula can be derived by row reversion.
This entails another triangle recurrence T(n,m) = (1 + (-1)^(n-m)*T(n-1,m-1) - (-1)^(n-m)*T(n-1,m), for n >= m >= 1 with T(n,m) = 0 if n < m and T(n,0)= (-1)^floor(n/2).
example: Example for A-sequence recurrence: T(3,1) = sum(A(j)*T(2,j), j=0..2) = 2*(-1) + 0*2 + (-1/2)*4 = -4. Example for Z-sequence recurrence: T(4,0) = sum(Z(j)*T(3,j), j=0..3) = 1*(-1) + (-1)*(-4) + (1/2)*4 + (-1/2)*8 = +1. (For the  A- and Z-sequences see a comment above.)
Example for the alternate recurrence: T(4,2) = 2*T(3,1) - T(3,2) = 2*(-4) - 4 = -12. T(4,3) = 0*T(3,2) + T(3,3) = T(3,3) = 8. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jul 30 2014
